A project charter is a crucial document that outlines the project's objectives, scope, timelines, and stakeholders. Here's a sample project charter for the new product line launch:

**Project Charter: New Product Line Launch**

**Project Title:** Launch of New Product Line for Major Retail Client

**Project Objective:**

The objective of this project is to successfully launch a new product line for our major retail client, meeting their business objectives and revenue targets. The new product line will be launched on June 1st, and our team will be responsible for developing and executing a comprehensive marketing strategy to drive sales, increase brand awareness, and enhance customer engagement.

**Project Scope:**

The project scope includes:

* Developing a comprehensive marketing strategy for the new product line
* Creating product packaging, point-of-sale materials, and marketing collateral
* Designing and developing e-commerce functionality on the client's website
* Creating product content, including product descriptions, videos, and images
* Developing and executing social media and email marketing campaigns
* Coordinating with the retail client for in-store displays and promotions
* Launching the new product line on June 1st

**Project Timelines:**

The project timeline is as follows:

* Week 1-2 (March 15 - 28): Project kickoff and planning
* Week 3-4 (March 29 - April 11): Product line development and creative assets creation
* Week 5-6 (April 12 - 25): Content creation and e-commerce development
* Week 7-8 (April 26 - May 9): Social media and email marketing campaign development
* Week 9-10 (May 10 - 23): Launch preparations and testing
* Week 11-12 (May 24 - June 1): Launch and post-launch activities

**Project Stakeholders:**

The following stakeholders will be involved in this project:

* Senior Marketing Manager (Project Lead)
* Graphic Designer
* Copywriter
* Social Media Specialist
* Email Marketing Specialist
* E-commerce Developer
* Product Manager (Retail Client)
* Creative Director
* Project Team Members (10 people)

**Project Deliverables:**

The project deliverables include:

* Comprehensive marketing strategy document
* Product packaging and point-of-sale materials
* Marketing collateral (brochures, flyers, etc.)
* E-commerce functionality on the client's website
* Product content (product descriptions, videos, images)
* Social media and email marketing campaigns
* Launch plan and post-launch report

**Project Budget:**

The project budget is [$X], which will be allocated across the various tasks and deliverables outlined above.

**Project Risks and Assumptions:**

The following risks and assumptions have been identified:

* Risk: Delays in creative assets development may impact launch timeline
* Assumption: The retail client will provide timely feedback and approvals on marketing materials
* Risk: Technical issues with e-commerce functionality may impact launch
* Assumption: The project team will have access to necessary resources and tools

By having a clear project charter, you'll be able to ensure that everyone on the project team is aligned and working towards the same goal. Remember to review and update the charter as needed throughout the project lifecycle.
